titlestmt.subtitle: An inventory of National Ballet at DC Public Library
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Leroy Graham/Faye Haskins.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-02-20 11:55:47 -0500.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The National Ballet was founded in 1962 by Jean Riddell as the resident ballet company of the Nation's capital. It gave its first performance on January 3, 1963 at Lisner Auditorium. During its 12 years, the company presented 1000 performances in Washington, D.C. and in 275 cites, including the U.S., Canada and Mexico. In the District, the Company performed first at the Lisner Auditorium and then the Kennedy Center. In 1974 the Company disbanded due to financial problems.

Frederick Franklin was the artistic director of the company from its beginning. Ben Stevenson joined Mr. Franklin as artistic director in 1971 whose first staged ballet was The Sleeping Beauty in observance of the inaugural season of the Kennedy Center. The company had a strong classical repertory, including Cinderella, Giselle, Coppelia, La Sylphide. Contemporary works it performed included Harliquinade, Bartok Concerto, and Three Preludes. Dancers who appeared regularly with the company included Christine Knobloch, Michelle Lees, Kirk Peterson, Fredric Strobel, and Dennis Poole. Famous guest artists included Margot Fonteyn, Violette Verdy, and Edward Villella.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Jean Riddell donated the records to the Library in 1976.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of trustee minutes, programs, advertisements, press releases, clippings, biographical files, promotional materials, and scrapbooks regarding the promotion and administration of the Ballet. The collection also contains musical scores, hanging plots, stage directions, board studies, set designs, videotapes, audiotapes, microforms, and photographs which document its artistic work. The records are arranged into 12 series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains minutes of the Board of Trustees of the National Ballet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains primarily photographs from performances of the National Ballet as well as a few programs. The folders are arranged alphabetically by title of the performance. The series also contains a chronology of the National Ballet Repertory from 1962-1967 prepared by Debra Devoe, which appears at the end of the series.

did.unittitle: Chronology of National Ballet repertory by Debra Devoe

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folders in the series contain files on certain dancers who performed with the National Ballet. The folders are arranged alphabetically first by name of the performer. Biographies and critics quotes for use by the press for certain performers as well as advance sheets appear at the end of the series.

did.unittitle: Biographies and critics quotes for use by the press
Biographies and critics quotes for use by the press

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains primarily programs, flyers, and other promotional materials for productions of the National Ballet. The materials are arranged chronologically by date of the performance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes correspondence, contracts, internal memoranda, stage information questionnaires, rehearsal and performance schedules, technical information sheets, reviews, and clippings regarding traveling performances of the Ballet. Performances took place in every region of the U.S. including such states as North Carolina, California, Alabama, New York, Texas, and Kansas. Handwritten log books maintained on the road to record schedules, staging requirements, and other notes on the performances appear first with the remainder of the materials arranged alphabetically by title of the performance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains press releases, editions of Ballerina: the National Ballet News, subscription flyers, and clippings regarding performances. A book containing clippings of advertisements for National Ballet performances is also contained in the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten stage directions for each play as well as some musical scores are contained in this series. Folders are arranged alphabetically by title of the ballet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains audiotapes, a videotape, microfilm of musical scores, and photographs. The materials are further arranged into subseries by format.

did.unittitle: Subseries 1: Audio and Video Recordings, ca. 1964-1974

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains 93 reel-to-reel audiotapes of ballets performed by the National Ballet. The series also contains a video film of a February 1973 performance on WTTG television by the company and tapes of interviews with members of the company, including Frederick Franklin and Ralph Black. The tapes are loosely arranged alphabetically by title with interviews and duplicates in other formats at the end.

did.unittitle: Britton's Young Persons Guide to the Orchestra
Tapes of interviews and unidentified tapes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains microfilm of selected scores from ballets performed by the company. The microfilm containers are loosely arranged by title of the ballet.

did.unittitle: Copelia Con Amore Pas de Deux

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains snapshots, proofsheets, a photo album commemorating the first 4 years of the company, and other photographs from rehearsals, performances, and the academic school of the National Ballet.

did.unittitle: 4 Ballerinas (Barr, Fulton, Lipinski, and Le Comte with Frederick Franklin)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains a small amount of records regarding the finances, history, and general administration of the company. Items include a history of the National Ballet, sample form letters, press book, Kennedy Center information, brochures worksheet, New York publicity, and printed material of the Ballet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains hanging plots, board studies, and set designs for selected performances of the National Ballet. The materials are loosely arranged alphabetically by title of the ballet.

did.unittitle: Hanging Plots and board studies for: Nutcracker, Graduation Ball, Concerto Baccaccio, Coppelia, Gisele, Homage, Les Sylphide, Prodigal Son, Swan Lake, Tango, and Witch Boy
Line plots, set design, etc. for Streetcar, Cinderella, Les Sylphide
Line plots, set design, etc. for Bartok Concerto, Blossom, Jacob's Pillow, Jungle, La Sonnambula, Les Sylphides, Meadow Brook, and Water Study

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains marked scores of music for ballets performed by the National Ballet. The scores are arranged alphabetically by title of the ballet.

did.unittitle: Touch and Go (Dance Variation for Piano)
Touch and Go (Dance Variation for Piano)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes scrapbooks of clippings, programs, invitations, press releases, and other memorabilia compiled to document the company's activities from 1962 through 1974. The series also contains two scrapbooks of clippings of magazine and newspaper articles from the 1940s about composers and conductors of the period such as Toscanini, Shostakovich, and Rachmaninoff.
